intro: Solanum andigenum convar. brevicalyces, commonly known as the Andean tomato, is a wild relative of the domesticated tomato. It is native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes in South America. The plant is a shrub with hairy stems and alternate, ovate leaves. Its flowers are typically yellow or greenish-yellow, with five petals, and it produces small, round fruits that are usually red when mature. This species is valued for its genetic diversity and potential use in breeding programs to improve cultivated tomatoes.
